Question: what exactly is mongodb and how is it different from sql
Answer: Mongodb is a nosql document oriented database unlike sql which uses tables and rows mongo uses collections and documents the big difference is that its schemaless meaning documents in the same collection dont have to have the same fields

Question: What is bson
Answer: It stands for binary json it is the format mongodb uses to store data like json but supports more data types like date and bindata and optimized for speed and space

Question: How do you start the mongodb shell
Answer: in the terminal you just type mongosh to connect to the running instance

Question: What is the default port for mongodb
Answer: the default port for mongodb is 27017

Question: What is a collection in mongodb
Answer: A collection is equivalent to a table in rdbms it is a group of mongodb documents

Question: How do you see all the databases on your server
Answer: Just type show dbs

Question: What command do you use to insert a single document
Answer: db.collection.insertOne({ ... })

Question: What is the id field
Answer: It is a unique identifier for every document if you dont provide one mongodb automatically generates an objectid for you

Question: How do you find a document where the name is Barrel
Answer: db.users.find({ name: "Barrel" })

Question: What is the 16mb limit
Answer: A single bson document in mongodb cannot exceed 16 megabytes

Question: What are roles in mongodb
Answer: They define permissions for examples read readwrite and dbadmin

Question: What is the mongod process
Answer: It is the primary daemon process for the mongodb system the server itself

Question: How do you check server status
Answer: db.serverStatus()

Question: What is mongodb atlas
Answer: mongodb atlas is the fully managed cloud version of mongodb provided as a service

Question: What is the use of push operator
Answer: It appends a new value to an array

Question: What is the use of pop
Answer: It removes either the first or the last element from an array

Question: How to rename a collection
Answer: db.collection.renameCollection("new_name")

Question: What is the difference between find and findone function
Answer: find returns a cursor to all matching documents while findone returns the actual first document that matches the criteri

Question: How do you update a specific field without overwriting the whole document
Answer: by use the set operator if you dont use set mongodb will replace the entire document with your new input

Question: How do you sort results in mongodb
Answer: Using the sort method Pass 1 for ascending and -1 for descending

Question: Explain projection in mongodb
Answer: Projection is used to select only the fields you need

Question: What are comparison operators in mongo
Answer: gt greater than lt less than gte greater or equal and ne not equal

Question: What does $match do in aggregation
Answer: It filters the documents similar to the find query or the where clause in sql it is best to put it at the start of the pipeline

Question: Can you sort inside an aggregation
Answer: yes using the operator $sort stage

Question: What is the primary node
Answer: The node that receives all write operations by default it also handles all reads unless configured otherwise

Question: Difference between vertical and horizontal scaling
Answer: Vertical is adding more ram and cpu to one server and  horizontal is adding more servers mongodb scales horizontally via sharding

Question: How do you handle one to many relationships
Answer: Either by nesting an array of sub documents or by storing the id of the parent in the child document

Question: How do you create a backup in mongodb
Answer: Using the mongodump utility to restore it you use mongorestore

Question: How do you find the current operations running on a server
Answer: db.currentOp()

Question: How do you update an item inside an array by its index
Answer: Using the dot notation like tags.0 to target the first item

Question: What is the size operator
Answer: It matches documents where an array is exactly a certain size

Question: What is the $regex operator
Answer: It allows you to search for strings using regular expressions

Question: How to count unique visitors
Answer: Use a Set and $addtoset with user ids or use an aggregation pipeline with $group

Question: How would you handle a search feature for blog posts
Answer: I would create a text index on the title and content fields and use the $text operator

Question: Why indexes are important in mongodb
Answer: Without them mongodb has to do a collection scan indexes store a small portion of the data in a traversable form to speed up searches

Question: What is a compound index
Answer: Compound index is an index on multiple fields

Question: Explain covered queries
Answer: A query is covered if the index contains all the fields requested by the query mongodb doesnt even need to look at the documents themselves

Question: What is a TTL Index
Answer: Time to live index it automatically removes documents from a collection after a certain amount of time

Question: Can you index an array field
Answer: Yes thats called a multikey index mongodb creates an index entry for every element in the array

Question: What is the aggregation pipeline
Answer: Aggregation pipeline is a framework for data processing you pass documents through stages like $match $group and $sort to transform them into a final result

Question: What is the $unwind stage
Answer: If a document has an array $unwind breaks it into multiple documents one for each element in the array this lets you run operations on individual array items

Question: How to implement a global search across all collections
Answer: Mongodb doesnt support this natively you would either need to aggregate results in the app or use atlas Search

Question: How do you handle concurrency when two users update the same document
Answer: Mongodb uses optimistic locking we can also implement a version field or use atomic operators like $set to ensure one doesnt wipe the other

Question: A user changes their username how do you update it across the app
Answer: If i referenced the user id i only update the user document if i embedded the username everywhere I would  have to run an updatemany across multiple collections

Question: What is the $expr operator
Answer: It allows you to use aggregation expressions within a regular query like comparing two fields in the same document

Question: What is the positional operator
Answer: Positional operator is used in an update to identify the specific element in an array that matched your query filter

Question: What is journaling
Answer: It is a log that helps mongodb recover in case of a crash by keeping track of data changes before they are written to the data files

Question: What is polymorphic schema
Answer: when documents in a collection have different structures but represent the same general entity

Question: Is mongodb acid compliant
Answer: Yes since version 4.0 mongodb supports multi document transactions with acid properties

Question: Can you join three collections
Answer: Yes by chaining multiple $lookup stages in an aggregation pipeline

Question: Why is mongodb called scalable
Answer: Because of sharding you can keep adding cheap commodity hardware to a cluster to handle more data and traffic without a single massive server
